message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.RO 

The paper deals with feature-based object matching, which is a fundamental problem in computer vision. The paper proposes a novel framework for simultaneously matching object instances in a set of images, which involves optimizing a partial permutation matrix for each image. This problem is related to several sub-categories of computer science, including computer vision (cs.CV), machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), multimedia (cs.MM), and robotics (cs.RO). However, given the focus on computer vision and image processing, cs.CV is the most likely sub-category, followed by cs.LG and cs.AI, which are related to optimization and machine learning. The other two sub-categories, cs.MM and cs.RO, are less likely but still relevant due to the application of the proposed method to 3D reconstruction, tracking, and motion segmentation.
